awd_titl_txt: Collaborative Research: Conference: 2023 CISE Education and Workforce PI and Community Meeting
awd_abstract_narration:
CISE Education and Workforce (EWF) programs aim to create equitable and inclusive opportunities for computing education and develop a diverse workforce. STARS Computing Corps, a CISE Broadening Participation in Computing Alliance, will support the 2023 CISE EWF Principal Investigator (PI) and Community Meetings. This convening will provide opportunities for the principal investigators of projects funded by CISE EWF programs to share their research outcomes, promising practices, and lessons learned. The PI meeting is intentionally co-located with the RESPECT Conference, to facilitate more engagement across research communities with shared interest in broadening participation in computing. The 2023 EWF PI meeting will also include an Aspiring PI workshop, providing guidance and insights for researchers new to EWF programs and/or NSF funding. 

The 2023 CISE EWF PI and Community Meeting will be a large event for the Foundation and the computer science education research community, bringing together PIs with representatives from government, academia, and non-profit. For this event, there is a pressing need to meticulously plan and organize agenda, venue and conference logistics. This grant provides funding for the venue and logistics, including conference registration, audio visual, and meeting space for the CISE EWF PI and Community meeting and Aspiring PI workshop.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: TEMPLE UNIVERSITY-OF THE COMMONWEALTH SYSTEM OF HIGHER EDUCATION

por.por_cntn:
This project supported the 2023 CISE Education and Workforce PI and Community meeting, a convening of program officers, principal investigators, and research community members to share research outcomes, with opportunities for PIs to share their research outcomes, promising practices, and lessons learned for the projects funded through the NSF CISE Education and Workforce programs. These programs share a common thread: advancing research to transform computing education at a national scale and broaden participation in computing. Projects represented included those from the Broadening Participation in Computing (BPC) program;  Computer Science for All (CSforAll RPP and Research) program; computing-focused Improving Undergraduate STEM Education projects, including those from the IUSE: Computing in Undergraduate Education (IUSE:CUE) program; the STEM + Computing K-12 Education (STEM+C) program; and the Research Experiences for Teachers in Engineering and Computer Science program.

The 2023 CISE Education and Workforce PI and Community meeting was held on June 21-23, 2023 in Atlanta, Georgia and engaged over 300 participants. In addition to disseminating project findings, this meeting provided an opportunity for the CISE EWF community to discuss future directions for research, exploring novel ideas for broadening participation in computing, enhancing computing education, and improving workforce preparation—as well as how to grow the community of researchers and practitioners in these areas. The meeting provided an opportunity for networking and community building, with PIs identifying potential areas of alignment and possible future collaborations. Serving also as a forum for sharing information about future NSF-wide priorities and the EWF vision with the PI community, NSF program officers had the opportunity to meet with attendees to discuss project ideas, provide feedback, and answer questions. In order to build capacity for CISE EWF proposal development and expand the collection of researchers and institutions within the CISE EWF PI community, the 2023 CISE EWF PI and Community Meeting introduced the inaugural CISE EWF Aspiring PI Summit as a track of the meeting. The API Summit was designed to provide prospective CISE EWF PIs with an opportunity to learn more about the types of research questions and projects that can be supported through the CISE EWF cluster, develop awareness of existing CISE EWF projects, and identify potential alignment and collaborations with other CISE EWF PIs. Additionally, attendees of the Aspiring PI Summit worked with experts to get feedback on early-phase proposals for CISE EWF programs, and to meet with CISE EWF program officers to discuss their revised early-phase proposal ideas.

As part of the meeting organization, an online project description booklet, containing a collection of one page project descriptions for each of the funded projects represented at the 2023 CISE Education and Workforce PI and Community Meeting, has been made publicly available along with a searchable project index. These and other meeting-related resources are available at https://www.cise-ewf-pi-2023.starscomputingcorps.org/.


Last Modified: 07/15/2024
Modified by: Jamie J Payton
